name: hay production, Swiss integrated production, extensive | hay, Swiss integrated production, extensive | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5820/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of hay (dry matter). The dry matter yield is 2702 kg/ha. Moisture content at storage is 12%.;;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

This activity describes the production of field-dried hay on a permanent natural meadow with a lifetime of 50 years and represents one year of cultivation on an established meadow. No input material are considered.


The dataset includes all machine operations and corresponding machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: mowing, swathing, haying, baling, loading of bales and roughage storage for 12 months in a barn. This activity ends after storage of hay at the farm gate.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0119:Growing of other non-perennial crops

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Refers to a production in the Swiss plateau (lowlands <700m).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Extensive production with drying in the field.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data were compiled from statistics, fertilising recommendations, documents from extension services and expert knowledge.

flow.name: hay, Swiss integrated production, extensive

flow.name: Energy, gross calorific value, in biomass

exchanges.description: Calculated value. See the parameters and their comments to understand the calculation.

See chapter 'Yields and Inputs of hay on permanent grassland' in '01_crop production - yields & inputs CH & Europe_v1.0.pdf', section 'AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION IN SWITZERLAND' - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent (www.ecoinvent.org/documentation)
This exchange has an activity link directly to the producing activity because the product is primarily consumed in the same geographical area where it is produced.
